metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4147 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Netfilter functionality when adding a rule with NFTA_RULE_CHAIN_ID. This flaw allows a local user to crash or escalate their privileges on the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-31-generic - 6.2.0-31.31
linux-image-6.2.0-31-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-31-generic - 6.2.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-31-generic-64k - 6.2.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-aws - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> same fix commit as CVE-2023-3995, one or the other will likely be marked as duplicated.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-31.31').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
